Lopez, who also acts as the film\'s producer, stars as Lauren Adrian, an American news reporter for the Chicago Sentinel who wants to be assigned to the Iraq front-lines to cover the war.<ref>{{cite news|last=Summers|first=Chris|url=http://news.bbc.co.uk/2/hi/americas/5268558.stm|title=Hollywood tackles Mexican mystery|date=September 10, 2006|publisher=BBC News|accessdate=July 24, 2012}}</ref> The film received a [[limited release]] in theaters throughout Europe in 2007 and a [[direct-to-video]] release in many other countries in 2008, including the United States. \'\'Bordertown\'\' was a commercial failure, grossing a total of $8 million worldwide, with its $21 million production budget.<ref>{{cite web|url=http://boxofficemojo.com/movies/?id=bordertown.htm |title=Bordertown |publisher=Box Office Mojo |date=July 8, 2012 |accessdate=August 8, 2012}}</ref><ref>{{cite web|url=http://www.abqtrib.com/news/2006/oct/19/nms-bordertown-hits-snag-loans |title=N.M.\'s \'Bordertown\' hits snag with loans | work= Albuquerque Tribune |publisher=Abqtrib.com |date=October 19, 2006 |accessdate=August 8, 2012}}</ref> \'\'[[DanceLife]]\'\', a reality series following the lives of seven dancers trying to break into the world of professional dance, aired on MTV from January 15 to March 5, 2007. Lopez produced, created and was featured in the show.<ref>{{cite web|url=http://www.mtv.com/shows/dancelife/series.jhtml |title=Dancelife &#124; Full Episodes, Photos, Episode Synopsis and Recaps |publisher=MTV News. Viacom International, Inc. |accessdate=August 8, 2012}}</ref> According to the album\'s co-producer Est\xc3\xa9fano, Lopez\'s fifth studio album \'\'[[Como Ama una Mujer]]\'\' would "prove critics wrong" with its "big songs that require a voice"; referring to the criticism of Lopez having a "limited" vocal tone.<ref name="Contactmusic Rebirth">{{cite web|url=http://www.contactmusic.com/pages/jenniferlopezx18x03x05|title=Jennifer Lopez&nbsp;\xe2\x80\x93 Rebirth&nbsp;\xe2\x80\x93 Album Review|publisher=Contactmusic.com|accessdate=April 1, 2012}}</ref><ref name="Contactmusic Spanish">{{cite web|url=http://www.contactmusic.com/news-article/j.lo-to-prove-critics-wrong-with-spanish-album_30_01_2006 |title=Jennifer Lopez&nbsp;\xe2\x80\x93 J.Lo To Prove Critics Wrong With Spanish Album |publisher=Contactmusic.com|date=January 30, 2006 |accessdate=June 3, 2012}}</ref> The album received the highest first-week sales in the United States for a Spanish album and the highest digital sales.<ref name="Como Ama Una Mujer Breaks Records">{{cite web|title=Jennifer Lopez\'s First Spanish-Language Album is an Instant No. 1 on the Billboard Latin Chart |url=http://www.prweb.com/releases/spanish/jennifer/prweb517033.htm|publisher=PRWeb. Vocus|accessdate=January 29, 2012|location=New York|date=April 6, 2007}}</ref>

In September 2007, Lopez starred in the [[biographical film]] \'\'[[El Cantante]]\'\', which is based on the life of the late [[salsa music|salsa]] singer [[H\xc3\xa9ctor Lavoe]]. In the film, Lavoe is portrayed by then-husband [[Marc Anthony]] while Lopez plays Lavoe\'s wife Puchi.<ref name="CantanteNYReview">{{cite web|url=http://www.nytimes.com/2007/08/03/movies/03cant.html?_r=0 |title=When the Salsa Throbs, a Singer\xe2\x80\x99s Soul Is Revealed |publisher=NYTimes.com|last=Scott|first=A. O.|date=August 3, 2007 |accessdate=August 16, 2014}}</ref> The film initially debuted at the [[Toronto International Film Festival]] on September 12, 2006, and received mixed reviews from critics.<ref name="CantanteNYReview"/> In an interview with [[Latina magazine]], Lopez revealed that she felt her performance in the film \'\'El Cantante\'\', should have earned her an Oscar.<ref name="CantanteOscar">{{cite web|url=http://www.nydailynews.com/entertainment/gossip/jennifer-lopez-deserved-oscar-nomination-role-el-cantante-article-1.198079 |title=Jennifer Lopez: I deserved an Oscar nomination for my role in \'El Cantante\' |publisher=nydailynews.com|last=Eisinger|first=Amy|date=January 6, 2010 |accessdate=August 16, 2014}}</ref> "I feel like I had that [Oscar worthy role] in \'El Cantante,\' but I don\'t think the academy members saw it".<ref name="CantanteOscar"/> Lopez and Anthony also launched their [[Jennifer Lopez and Marc Anthony en Concierto|co-headlining North American concert tour]] on September 28. The tour grossed an estimated $10 million, with one dollar from each ticket sold being donated to Run for Something Better\xe2\x80\x94a charitable organization supporting physical fitness programs for children.<ref>{{cite journal|author=Cobo, Leila|date=June 7, 2008|title=Together Again|journal=Billboard|volume=120|issue=23|location=New York City, New York|publisher=Nielsen Business Media, Inc|issn=0006-2510|accessdate=May 28, 2012|url=http://books.google.com/books?id=_hIEAAAAMBAJ&lpg=PA1&pg=PA10#v=onepage&q&f=false|page=10}}</ref><ref name="ld1">{{cite web|url=http://www.soundspike.com/story2/12624/jennifer-lopez-to-drop-brave-new-album/|title=Jennifer Lopez to drop \'Brave\' new album|last=Kilgore|first=Kym|date=August 13, 2007|accessdate=September 4, 2010|work=LiveDaily|archiveurl=http://www.freezepage.com/1338238555ICJBKARMZN |archivedate=May 28, 2012}}</ref>

Lopez\'s sixth studio album \'\'[[Brave (Jennifer Lopez album)|Brave]]\'\', released in October, was her lowest-charting album worldwide.<ref name="lovereview"/> The album produced two singles, "[[Do It Well]]" and "[[Hold It Don\'t Drop It]]". The first peaked at number 31 on the [[Billboard Hot 100|\'\'Billboard\'\' Hot 100]] chart, while the latter failed to make any significant impact on the charts. A five-part [[miniseries]], \'\'[[Jennifer Lopez Presents: Como Ama una Mujer]]\'\', based on the lyrics of \'\'Como Ama una Mujer\'\' aired on [[Univision]] from October 30 to November 27, 2007. In late 2009, Lopez released two songs for her seventh studio album, \'\'[[Love? (album)|Love?]]\'\' ("[[Louboutins (song)|Louboutins]]" and "Fresh Out of the Oven"); however, the songs failed to make an appearance on the \'\'Billboard\'\' charts which led to her departure from [[Epic Records]].<ref>{{cite web|url=http://www.nydailynews.com/entertainment/gossip/louboutins-fresh-oven-flop-epic-records-jennifer-lopez-boot-source-article-1.194874 |title=After \'Louboutins\', \'Fresh Out of the Oven\' flop, Epic Records gives Jennifer Lopez the boot: source |publisher=nydailynews.com|author=Gatecrasher|date=February 23, 2010 |accessdate=August 16, 2014}}</ref>

===2010\xe2\x80\x9312: Career rejuvenation and \'\'American Idol\'\'===
Lopez parted ways with Epic Records in February 2010, citing that she had fulfilled her contractual obligations and now wished to release her seventh studio album \'\'[[Love?]]\'\' under a new label.<ref name="Billboard Lopez Leaves Sony">{{cite web|url=http://www.billboard.com/articles/news/959279/updated-jennifer-lopez-confirms-split-with-epic-records |title=Updated: Jennifer Lopez Confirms Split With Epic Records |work=[[Billboard (magazine)|Billboard]]|publisher=[[Prometheus Global Media]] | author= Concepcion, Mariel; Ben-Yehuda, Ayala; Caulfield, Kieth |date=February 23, 2010 |accessdate=March 16, 2010}}</ref> Her departure from the label temporarily halted production on the album, which commenced in 2009. Upon signing a new contract with [[Island Records]], recording resumed on the album.<ref>{{cite web|author=Sarah |url=http://www.usmagazine.com/entertainment/news/record-producer-spills-justin-bieber-katy-perry-and-j-los-studio-secrets-2010167 |title=Record Producer Spills Justin Bieber, Katy Perry and J.Lo\'s Studio Secrets |work=[[Us Weekly]] |publisher=[[Wenner Media]] |date=June 16, 2010 |accessdate=October 2, 2010}}</ref> The \'\'[[Daily News (New York)|New York Daily News]]\'\' revealed that Lopez would be taking some of the records recorded under Sony Music Entertainment to her new label so that they could be included on the album.<ref>{{cite news|author=Gatecrasher |url=http://articles.nydailynews.com/2010-02-24/gossip/27057095_1_el-cantante-sony-music-second-source |title=After \'Louboutins\', \'Fresh Out of the Oven\' flop, Epic Records gives Jennifer Lopez the boot |work=[[Daily News (New York)|Daily News]] |publisher=[[Mortimer Zuckerman]] |date=February 24, 2010 |accessdate=May 4, 2012}}</ref> In April, Lopez starred in the romantic comedy \'\'[[The Back-up Plan]]\'\', her first theatrical role in three years.<ref name="Rovi Back Up Plan">{{cite web|first=Jason |last=Buchanan |url=http://www.allrovi.com/movies/movie/the-back-up-plan-v490905 |title=The Back-up Plan&nbsp;\xe2\x80\x93 Cast, Reviews, Summary, and Awards |publisher=AllRovi. Rovi Corporation |accessdate=October 30, 2011}}</ref> Having grossed a modest $77 million worldwide, the film received lukewarm critical reviews for "unrelatable characters" and a "predictable plot", although Lopez\'s acting was praised.<ref>{{cite web |url=http://boxofficemojo.com/movies/?id=backupplan.htm |title=The Back-up Plan (2010) |publisher=Box Office Mojo |accessdate=November 27, 2011}}</ref><ref>{{cite web|url=http://www.rottentomatoes.com/m/back_up_plan |title=The Back-up Plan |publisher=Rotten Tomatoes. Flixster |accessdate=August 8, 2012}}</ref> In June, following the departure of [[Ellen DeGeneres]] from \'\'[[American Idol]]\'\', it was reported that Lopez was in talks to join season ten\'s judging panel.<ref>{{cite web|url=http://www.usmagazine.com/celebritynews/news/source-jennifer-lopez-to-be-an-american-idol-judge-2010307 |title=Source: Jennifer Lopez to Be an American Idol Judge&nbsp;\xe2\x80\x93 Celebrity News |work=Us Weekly |publisher=Wenner Media |accessdate=August 6, 2011}}</ref><ref>{{cite news| url=http://www.nydailynews.com/entertainment/tv/2010/07/29/2010-07-29_ellen_degeneres_leaving_american_idol.html | location=New York | work=Daily News |publisher=Mortimer Zuckerman |title=Ellen DeGeneres leaves \'American Idol\'; Jennifer Lopez reportedly close to replacing her | first=Bill | last=Hutchinson | date=July 30, 2010}}</ref><ref>{{cite news| url=http://latimesblogs.latimes.com/showtracker/2010/07/american-idols-backup-plan-with-jennifer-lopez-not-ready-for-delivery.html | work=Los Angeles Times | publisher=Tribune Company| title=Show Tracker | date=July 30, 2010}}</ref> During this same time, Lopez and Anthony were being considered for a role on \'\'[[The X Factor (U.S.)|The X Factor]]\'\' for their appeal to Latin and International markets.<ref>{{cite web|author=|url=http://www.digitalspy.co.uk/ustv/s103/the-x-factor/news/a219700/lopez-anthony-linked-to-us-x-factor.html |title=US TV&nbsp;\xe2\x80\x93 News&nbsp;\xe2\x80\x93 Lopez, Anthony linked to US \'X Factor\' |publisher=[[Digital Spy]]. Hearst Magazines UK |date=May 13, 2010 |accessdate=September 18, 2010}}</ref> It was officially announced in September that Lopez would be joining the [[American Idol (season 10)|tenth season]] of \'\'American Idol\'\'. MTV stated that the deal was "mutually beneficial to all those involved", while [[CNN]] reported that Lopez was viewing it as a decision to revive her career, while \'\'American Idol\'\' producers believed that Lopez and [[Steven Tyler]]\'s appointments would strengthen viewing figures.<ref>{{cite news| url=http://edition.cnn.com/2010/SHOWBIZ/TV/09/22/jennifer.lopez.american.idol/ |publisher=CNN | title=Jennifer Lopez: A reality TV revival? | date=September 23, 2010}}</ref> In October, Lopez released her fourteenth fragrance, Love and Glamour. The perfume was inspired by Lopez\'s forthcoming "return to the spotlight".<ref>{{cite web|author=@ 3:07&nbsp;pm |url=http://news.instyle.com/2010/06/07/jennifer-lopez-launches-love-and-glamour |title=Jennifer Lopez Launches Love and Glamour |work=[[InStyle]] |publisher=Time Inc.|date=June 7, 2010 |accessdate=August 8, 2012}}</ref>

{{Listen
|filename = JenniferLopez_OntheFloor.ogg
|title = "On the Floor" (2011)
|description = A 22-second sample of "On the Floor", which combines a sample of "[[Llorando se fue]]" by [[Los Kjarkas]], with [[dance music|dance]], [[house music|house]] and [[Latin American music|Latin music]].
|pos = right
}}

[[L\'Oreal]] Paris named Lopez their new Global Ambassador and the face of their brands, including EverPure hair care, Preference hair color and Youth Code skin care. Her EverSleek hair care ads made their debut in early 2011, to coincide with the release of \'\'Love?\'\' and her debut as a judge on \'\'American Idol\'\'.<ref>{{cite web|url=http://www.realstylenetwork.com/blogs/beauty/2010/12/jennifer-lopez-named-loreal-paris-global-ambassador |title=Jennifer Lopez Named L\'Oreal Paris Global Ambassador |publisher=Real Style Network |date=December 3, 2010 |accessdate=August 8, 2012}}</ref> To further promote her comeback, in February, [[Gillette Mach3|Venus]] chose Lopez as their new Global Ambassador.<ref>{{cite web|url=http://www.realstylenetwork.com/blogs/beauty/2011/02/jennifer-lopez-is-the-new-venus-global-ambassador |title=Jennifer Lopez Is The New Venus Global Ambassador |publisher=Real Style Network |date=February 3, 2011 |accessdate=August 8, 2012}}</ref> Lopez\'s comeback single "[[On the Floor]]" was released later that same month. The song topped the charts across the globe, becoming one of the most successful singles of the year.<ref name="Digital report 2012">{{cite web|title=IFPI digital music report 2012&nbsp;\xe2\x80\x93 key facts and figures |url=http://ifpi.com/content/library/DMR2012_key_facts_and_figures.pdf|publisher=[[International Federation of the Phonographic Industry]]|accessdate=January 23, 2012}}</ref> The song also became her highest charting single commercially as a lead artist, as well as her most successful airplay hit on [[contemporary hit radio]], since "Jenny from the Block".<ref>{{cite web |url=http://www.billboard.com/articles/news/471634/beastie-boys-score-no-2-debut-on-billboard-200-adele-holds-at-no-1 |title=Beastie Boys Score No. 2 Debut on Billboard 200, Adele Holds at No. 1 |work=Billboard |publisher=Prometheus Global Media |last=Caulfield |first=Keith |date=May 11, 2011 |accessdate=May 29, 2011}}</ref> \'\'Love?\'\', which was released in May, was a moderate commercial success, and was viewed as a humble comeback from Lopez, as many had considered her recording career over.<ref name=lovereview>{{cite web|last=Copsey|first=Robert|title=Jennifer Lopez: \'Love?\'|url=http://www.digitalspy.com.au/music/albumreviews/a317729/jennifer-lopez-love.html|publisher=Digital Spy. Hearst Magazines UK|accessdate=January 29, 2012|date=May 4, 2011}}</ref> Lopez launched her next fragrance Love and Light in July, exclusively on HSN. 51,000 bottles of the fragrance were sold at its premiere, becoming Lopez\'s most successful fragrance launch to date, making over $2.9 million.<ref>{{cite web |url=http://news.instyle.com/2011/07/07/jennifer-lopez-hsn-love-and-light-sales |title=Jennifer Lopez HSN&nbsp;\xe2\x80\x93 Love & Light |work=InStyle |publisher= Time Inc.|date=July 7, 2011 |accessdate=August 8, 2012}}</ref> In September, Lopez launched the [[Jennifer Lopez Collection]], a clothing and accessories line for [[Kohl\'s]] with [[Tommy Hilfiger]].<ref name="goahead">{{cite web|title=Jennifer Lopez&nbsp;\xe2\x80\x93 Jennifer Lopez\'s Fashion Line To Go Ahead|url=http://www.contactmusic.com/news/jennifer-lopezs-fashion-line-to-go-ahead_1233187|publisher=Contactmusic.com|accessdate=February 5, 2012|date=July 19, 2011}}</ref> In addition to the clothing line, she also launched the Jennifer Lopez Home Collection, featuring bedding, towels and luggage.<ref name="Lopez Previews Her Kohl\'s Collection">{{cite web|title=Jennifer Lopez Previews Her Kohl\'s Collection|url=http://stylenews.peoplestylewatch.com/2011/08/12/jennifer-lopez-for-kohls|publisher=Style News|accessdate=January 31, 2012|date=August 12, 2011}}</ref> Later that same month [[Fiat]], an Italian automobile manufacturer, enlisted Lopez to promote their products, including the [[Fiat 500 (2007)|2012 Fiat 500 Cabrio]]. Olivier Francois, the [[Chrysler]] chief marketing officer, stated that she "fits perfectly with the brand".<ref>{{cite web|last=Lienert |first=Anita |url=http://www.insideline.com/fiat/500/2012/fiat-and-jennifer-lopez-hook-up.html |title=Fiat and Jennifer Lopez Hook Up |publisher=[[Insideline]] |date=September 13, 2011 |accessdate=August 8, 2012}}</ref>

In January 2012, Lopez returned as judge on the [[American Idol (season 11)|eleventh season]] of \'\'American Idol\'\', earning a reported $20 million.<ref name="Forbes2">{{cite news|author=Hannah Elliott |url=http://www.forbes.com/sites/hannahelliott/2012/05/16/the-real-american-idol-how-j-lo-got-her-mojo-back/ |title=The Real American Idol: How J.Lo Got Her Mojo Back |work=[[Forbes]] |publisher=Forbes Publishing |date=April 18, 2012 |accessdate=May 24, 2012}}</ref> Later that same month, a new talent show, \'\'[[Q\'Viva! The Chosen|\xc2\xa1Q\'Viva! The Chosen]]\'\', created by [[Simon Fuller]] premiered on [[Univision]] and was a hit for the channel.<ref>{{cite news|last=Sheridan|first=Emily|title=\'Sometimes you don\'t agree and I say be quiet\': Jennifer Lopez admits it can be difficult working with estranged husband Marc Anthony|url=http://www.dailymail.co.uk/tvshowbiz/article-2094297/Jennifer-Lopez-admits-difficult-working-estranged-husband-Marc-Anthony.html|work=[[Daily Mail]] |publisher=[[Associated Newspapers]]|accessdate=February 12, 2012|date=January 31, 2012|location=London}}</ref><ref>{{cite news| url=http://www.hollywoodreporter.com/news/jennifer-lopez-marc-anthonys-qviva-250584 | work=[[The Hollywood Reporter]] |publisher=[[Prometheus Global Media]] | title=Jennifer Lopez and Marc Anthony\'s \'Q\'Viva: The Chosen\': First Broadcast Partners Announced | date=October 19, 2011}}</ref> It followed Lopez, Anthony and director-choeographer [[Jamie King]] as they travelled across 21 countries in Latin America to find new talent for a [[Las Vegas Valley|Las Vegas]] show. On May 18, Lopez returned to the big screen starring alongside an [[ensemble cast]] consisting of [[Cameron Diaz]], [[Elizabeth Banks]], [[Matthew Morrison]] and [[Dennis Quaid]] in the film \'\'[[What to Expect When You\'re Expecting (film)|What to Expect When You\'re Expecting]]\'\'.<ref name="Lopez">{{cite news|url=http://insidemovies.ew.com/2011/06/24/jennifer-lopez-what-to-expect-when-youre-expecting|title=Jennifer Lopez signs on for \'What to Expect When You\'re Expecting\'|last=Labrecque|first=Jeff|work=[[Entertainment Weekly]]|publisher=[[Time Inc.]]|date=June 24, 2011|accessdate=July 23, 2011<!--archiveurl=http://www.webcitation.org/60O53uOVo |archivedate=July 23, 2011 -->}}</ref> Based on the [[What to Expect When You\'re Expecting|novel of the same name]], Lopez plays Holly, a woman who adopts a baby from abroad with her husband after difficulty conceiving. The film was a moderate success at the box office with a total gross of $84 million, although it received negative reviews.<ref>{{cite web|url=http://boxofficemojo.com/movies/?id=whattoexpect.htm |title=What to Expect When You\'re Expecting (2012) |publisher=Box Office Mojo |date=May 27, 2012 |accessdate=July 10, 2012}}</ref><ref>{{cite web|url=http://www.rottentomatoes.com/m/what_to_expect_when_youre_expecting |title=What to Expect When You\'re Expecting |publisher=Rotten Tomatoes. Flixster|accessdate=August 8, 2012}}</ref> In late May, Lopez released her fragrance Glowing by JLo, which she described as an "evolution" of Glow by JLo.<ref name="Huffington">{{cite news|first=Michelle |last=Manetti |url=http://www.huffingtonpost.com/2012/02/10/glowing-jennifer-lopez-launching-new-fragrance_n_1268972.html |title=Jennifer Lopez Launches \'Glowing\' Perfume With Naked Ad, Light-Up Bottle (Photos) |work=[[The Huffington Post]] |publisher=[[AOL]]|accessdate=March 3, 2012 |date=February 10, 2012}}</ref>

[[File:Jennifer Lopez 2, 2012.jpg|thumb|left|180px|Lopez performing during her [[Dance Again World Tour]], June 2012.]]

Lopez launched the [[Dance Again World Tour]], her first headlining concert tour, on June 14.<ref name="My Diary May 3">{{cite web |url=http://jenniferlopez.com/blog/post/my-diary|title=My Diary |date=May 3, 2012 |publisher=Jennifer Lopez Website |accessdate=May 13, 2012|archiveurl=http://www.freezepage.com/1336988633AFEXHXNLRN |archivedate=May 13, 2012}}</ref> It was a lucrative, grossing over $1 million per show.<ref name="Forbes 2013" /> On July 12, Lopez launched [[Teeology]], a luxury [[T-shirt]] [[e-commerce]].<ref>{{cite web|author=Andrea Huspeni |url=http://www.businessinsider.com/jennifer-lopez-to-launch-teeology-2012-7 |title=Jennifer Lopez to Launch Teeology |publisher=Business Insider, Inc. |date=July 12, 2012 |accessdate=August 5, 2012}}</ref> Lopez voiced Shira, a saber tooth tiger, in the animated film, \'\'[[Ice Age: Continental Drift]]\'\', the fourth film in the \'\'[[Ice Age (franchise)|Ice Age]]\'\' franchise.<ref name="Rovi Ice Age 4">{{cite web|first=Jeremy |last=Wheeler |url=http://www.allrovi.com/movies/movie/ice-age-continental-drift-3d-v516738 |title=Ice Age: Continental Drift 3D&nbsp;\xe2\x80\x93 Cast, Reviews, Summary, and Awards |publisher=AllRovi. Rovi Corporation |accessdate=October 30, 2011}}</ref> The film debuted at number one at the US box office, having grossed $46 million in its opening weekend, becoming Lopez\'s highest opening weekend figure.<ref>{{cite news|agency=Associated Press|url=http://www.dailymail.co.uk/news/article-2174019/Ice-Age-4-Continental-Drift-movie-tops-box-office-46m-opening-weekend.html|title=Ice Age movie tops box office with $46 million opening weekend...but Batman is lurking to snatch the title|date=July 15, 2012|work=[[Daily Mail]]|publisher=Associated Newspapers, Ltd.|accessdate=July 24, 2012}}</ref> With a $95 million production budget, the film has since grossed $877 million worldwide.<ref>{{cite web|url=http://boxofficemojo.com/movies/?id=iceage4.htm |title=Ice Age: Continental Drift (2012) |publisher=Box Office Mojo |date=July 13, 2012 |accessdate=November 1, 2012}}</ref>

Lopez\'s first greatest hits album, \'\'[[Dance Again... the Hits]]\'\', was released on July 24, 2012 in the United States.<ref>{{cite web|author=|url=http://www.digitalspy.com/music/news/a388349/jennifer-lopez-to-release-dance-again-the-hits-next-month.html |title=Jennifer Lopez to release \'Dance Again: The Hits\' next month? |publisher=Digital Spy. Hearst Magazines UK |date=June 19, 2012 |accessdate=July 10, 2012}}</ref> It was released by Epic Records, as Lopez owed them one final album to end her contract, despite previously announcing that she had fulfilled her contract with the label.<ref name="radio1">{{cite web|url=http://925maxima.radio.com/2012/05/28/jennifer-lopez-interview-new-single-goin-in |title=Jennifer Lopez Talks About Her New Single "Goin\' In" |publisher=925maxima Radio|date=May 28, 2012 |accessdate=June 23, 2012}}</ref> Lopez, who was going through a divorce with Anthony and the "breakup of a family", felt as if the album\'s sole single, "[[Dance Again]]", had come to her at the "perfect moment".<ref name="ryaninterview">{{cite web|first=Michael |last=Murray |url=http://ryanseacrest.com/2012/03/30/jennifer-lopez-talks-dance-again-her-upcoming-album-audio/ |title=Jennifer Lopez Talks \'Dance Again\' & Her Upcoming \'Greatest Hits\' Album |publisher=Ryan Seacrest Productions|date=March 30, 2012 |accessdate=March 31, 2012}}</ref><ref name="AOL2">{{cite web|last=Gayles|first=Contessa|title=Jennifer Lopez, Divorce: Real Reason Singer Went on World Tour?|url=http://blog.music.aol.com/2012/12/06/jennifer-lopez-divorce-tour/|publisher=[[AOL|AOL Music Blog]]|accessdate=December 7, 2012|date=December 6, 2012}}</ref> "Dance Again" and "[[Goin\' In]]", a single from the soundtrack of the dance film \'\'[[Step Up Revolution]]\'\', both reached the top of the \'\'Billboard\'\' Hot Dance Club Songs, giving Lopez her twelfth and thirteenth number one on that chart, respectively. Additionally, "Goin\' In" became her tenth consecutive number one on the chart, tying [[Katy Perry]] for having the most consecutive numbers ones on the chart.<ref>{{cite web|url=http://www.billboard.com/articles/chartbeat/480578/chart-highlights-gotye-extends-multi-format-chart-success |title=Latest Music News, Band, Artist, Musician & Music Video News |publisher=[[Prometheus Global Media]] |work=Billboard |date=August 6, 2012 |accessdate=August 8, 2012}}</ref> [[nuvoTV]] announced in September its premier partnership with Lopez, that will see her work on the creative side of the network, managing marketing and program production with her production company, [[Nuyorican Productions]], as well as periodically appearing in network programming.<ref name="Jennifer Lopez Partnering With NuvoTV">{{cite news|url=http://www.huffingtonpost.com/2012/09/13/jennifer-lopez-nuvotv_n_1880503.html |title=Jennifer Lopez Partnering With NuvoTV, Takes Equity Stake In Cable Network |work=The Huffington Post|publisher=AOL|date=September 13, 2012 |accessdate=September 16, 2012 |first=Samreen |last=Hooda}}</ref><ref name="Jennifer Lopez to Take Minority Stake in Cable\'s Nuvo TV">{{cite web|last=Steinberg |first=Brian |url=http://adage.com/article/media/jennifer-lopez-minority-stake-cable-s-nuvo-tv/237139 |title=Jennifer Lopez to Take Minority Stake in Cable\'s Nuvo TV |work=[[Advertising Age]] |publisher=[[Crain Communications]] Inc |date=September 12, 2012 |accessdate=September 16, 2012}}</ref> In December, Lopez held a charity drive that would affect her three favorite charities: the [[Gloria Wise Boys and Girls Club]], the Children\'s Hospital of Los Angeles as well as the [[American Red Cross]] which would mainly benefit victims of [[Hurricane Sandy]] which devastated parts of her home town, New York City.<ref name="HSp">{{cite web|last=Moody|first=Nekesa|title=Jennifer Lopez on Holiday Charity Drive and Jenni Rivera: \'It\'s a Wake-Up Call\'|url=http://www.billboard.com/articles/columns/latin-notas/1481338/jennifer-lopez-on-holiday-charity-drive-and-jenni-rivera-its-a|work=Billboard|publisher=Prometheus Global Media|accessdate=January 3, 2013|date=December 17, 2012}}</ref>

===2013\xe2\x80\x93present: \'\'A.K.A.\'\' and other projects===
In January 2013, Lopez starred alongside [[Jason Statham]] in the crime thriller \'\'[[Parker (2013 film)|Parker]]\'\', in which she played Leslie. Her performance earned positive reviews, with \'\'[[Chicago Tribune]]\'\' commending the role for giving Lopez "an opportunity to be dramatic, romantic, funny, depressed, euphoric and violent. The audience stays with her all the way".<ref>{{cite news|url=http://www.chicagotribune.com/entertainment/sns-201301251600--tms--lizsmittr--x-a20130128-20130128,0,6035496.story |title=Hackford\'s \'Parker\' packs a big punch |publisher=\'\'Chicago Tribune\'\'. [[Tribune Company]] |date=January 28, 2013 |accessdate=December 5, 2013 |archiveurl=http://web.archive.org/web/20130729082325/http://www.chicagotribune.com/entertainment/sns-201301251600--tms--lizsmittr--x-a20130128-20130128,0,6035496.story |archivedate=2013-07-29}}</ref> It under-performed at the box office, however.<ref>{{cite web|title=Parker-Box Office Data|url=http://www.the-numbers.com/movie/Parker|publisher=\'\'The Numbers\'\'|accessdate=May 6, 2013}}</ref> The following month, she gained widespread notoriety for wearing a daring black dress at the [[2013 Grammy Awards|Grammy Awards]] which revealed her entire right leg; despite a conservative dress code which had been issued to celebrities in attendance.<ref>{{cite journal|author=Christie D\'Zurilla |url=http://www.latimes.com/entertainment/envelope/gossip/la-et-mg-jennifer-lopez-vs-angelina-jolie-leg-grammys-20130210,0,5894431.story |title=Jennifer Lopez vs. Angelina Jolie: Which leg do you love? |journal=Los Angeles Times|publisher=Tribune Company|date=February 11, 2013 |accessdate=April 19, 2013}}</ref> In May, Lopez was announced as the [[chief creative officer]] of nuvoTV. In addition, she founded the mobile phone retail brand [[Viva M\xc3\xb3vil]], which is catered specifically for Latinos.<ref>{{cite web|last=Cheng |first=Roger |url=http://reviews.cnet.com/8301-12261_7-57585831-10356022/jennifer-lopez-dishes-on-new-viva-movil-shopping-q-a |title=Jennifer Lopez dishes on new Viva Movil shopping (Q&A) |publisher=Cnet Reviews|date=May 23, 2013 |accessdate=May 24, 2013}}</ref> In these media ventures, Lopez hoped to empower the Latin community, stating that: "We\'re realizing our power. We\'re realizing that we matter here. You know, we\'re not just, you know, the guys working behind the scenes in the kitchens and as a plumber."<ref name="Latino1">{{cite news|url=http://latino.foxnews.com/latino/entertainment/2013/06/13/jennifer-lopez-wants-latinos-to-realizing-our-power/#ixzz2WAJjWeWg |title=Jennifer Lopez Wants Latinos To Realize Their Power |publisher=Fox News Latino|date=June 13, 2013 |accessdate=June 18, 2013}}</ref> She began politically lobbying for more Hispanic diversity on television;<ref>{{cite news|author=Debbie Emery |url=http://www.dailymail.co.uk/tvshowbiz/article-2340639/Jennifer-Lopez-makes-strong-political-stance-power-suit-spiked-stilettos-takes-Washington-DC.html?ito=feeds-newsxml |title=Jennifer Lopez makes a strong political stance in a power suit and spiked stilettos when she takes on Washington DC |publisher=\'\'Daily News\'\' (Associated Newspapers, Ltd.)|date=June 14, 2013 |accessdate=June 18, 2013}}</ref> "There\'s a big revolution going on, it\'s like a media and cultural revolution of Latinos here in the United States. We\'re realizing our power. We\'re realizing that we matter here."<ref name="Latino1" />

Inspired by her gay aunt who had died, Lopez signed on as executive producer of the television series \'\'[[The Fosters (2013 TV series)|The Fosters]]\'\', which is about a same sex couple raising a family.<ref>{{cite news|author=April 24, 2013 4:53 pm EDT |url=http://www.huffingtonpost.com/2013/04/24/jennifer-lopez-declares-the-fosters_n_3149200.html |title=Jennifer Lopez\'s Lesbian Aunt: Star Says \'The Fosters\' TV Show Inspired By Late Relative |work=The Huffington Post |publisher=AOL |date=April 24, 2013 |accessdate=May 31, 2013}}</ref> The show premiered on [[ABC Family]] on June 3, 2013, and has since been a ratings success for the network.<ref>{{cite web|url=http://tvbythenumbers.zap2it.com/2013/06/11/monday-cable-ratings-love-hip-hop-wins-night-wwe-raw-teen-wolf-major-crimes-switched-at-birth-longmire-more/186745/|title=Monday Cable Ratings: \xe2\x80\x98Love & Hip Hop\xe2\x80\x99 Wins Night, \xe2\x80\x98WWE Raw\xe2\x80\x99, \xe2\x80\x98Teen Wolf\xe2\x80\x99, \xe2\x80\x98Major Crimes\xe2\x80\x99 , \xe2\x80\x98Switched at Birth\xe2\x80\x99, \xe2\x80\x98Longmire\xe2\x80\x99 & More&nbsp;\xe2\x80\x93 Ratings |last=Bibel|first=Sara |work=The Numbers|publisher=Tribune Media Services|date=June 11, 2013}}</ref> She was awarded the Ally for Equality award presented by the [[Human Rights Campaign]].<ref>{{cite web|title=HRC to Honor Jennifer Lopez with Ally for Equality Award at 2013 National Dinner|url=http://www.hrc.org/blog/entry/hrc-to-honor-jennifer-lopez-with-ally-for-equality-award-at-2013-national-d|work=HRC Blog|publisher=Human Rights Campaign|accessdate=September 25, 2013|date=September 20, 2013}}</ref> Later that June, Lopez performed at the birthday of  [[Turkmenistan]] President [[Gurbanguly Berdymukhamedov]].<ref name="Turkmenistan, Washington Post" /> Doing so, she garnered widespread backlash for performing for the leader of a "repressive, authoritarian regime".<ref>{{cite web|title=J. Lo comes under attack after singing for leader of Turkmenistan|url=http://twitchy.com/2013/06/30/j-lo-comes-under-attack-after-singing-for-leader-of-turkmenistan/?utm_source=twitterfeed&utm_medium=twitter|publisher=Twitchy.com|accessdate=June 30, 2013|date=June 30, 2013}}</ref> Her publicist released an apology.<ref name="Turkmenistan, Washington Post">{{cite news|title=Jennifer Lopez apologizes for Turkmenistan performance|url=http://www.washingtonpost.com/blogs/reliable-source/wp/2013/06/30/jennifer-lopez-sings-for-dictator-paula-deen-loses-cookbook/|work=[[The Washington Post]]|publisher=[[The Washington Post Company]]|accessdate=July 1, 2013|date=June 30, 2013}}</ref> Lopez returned as judge on \'\'American Idol\'\' for its [[American Idol (season 13)|thirteenth season]] for a reported salary of $17.5 million.<ref>{{cite web|title=Lopez to earn USD 17.5 million for American Idol return|url=http://www.business-standard.com/article/pti-stories/lopez-to-earn-usd-17-5-million-for-american-idol-return-113090100045_1.html|work=Business Standard|publisher=Business Standard Ltd|accessdate=September 24, 2013|date=September 1, 2013}}</ref> She was ranked as the fifth highest-paid woman in music for 2013, having earned $45 million.<ref name="Forbes 2013">{{cite web|title=No. 5: Jennifer Lopez ($45 million)|url=http://www.forbes.com/pictures/eeel45eglhi/no-5-jennifer-lopez-45-million/|website=Forbes|publisher=Forbes, Inc.|accessdate=February 8, 2015}}</ref> After the conclusion of her Dance Again World Tour, Lopez began recording her eighth studio album, \'\'[[A.K.A. (album)|A.K.A.]]\'\', inspired by her travels.<ref>{{cite web|title=Lopez didn\'t expect new album so soon|url=http://au.news.yahoo.com/entertainment/a/-/entertainment/17557067/lopez-didnt-expect-new-album-so-soon/|publisher=Yahoo! News. Yahoo! Inc|accessdate=June 13, 2013|date=June 11, 2013}}</ref> It was released in June 2014 through [[Capitol Records]], experiencing lackluster sales.<ref>{{cite web|last1=Lipshutz|first1=Jason|title=Jennifer Lopez\'s \'A.K.A.\' Debut: An Icon Reaches a Crossroads|url=http://www.billboard.com/articles/columns/pop-shop/6141007/jennifer-lopez-aka-debut-sales-pop-column|website=Billboard|publisher=[[Prometheus Global Media]]|accessdate=January 24, 2015|date=June 30, 2014}}</ref> The album produced three singles: "[[I Luh Ya Papi]]" which features [[French Montana]], "[[First Love (Jennifer Lopez song)|First Love]]", and "[[Booty (song)|Booty]]", featuring Pitbull or rapper [[Iggy Azalea]]. "Booty" reached the top twenty in the United States.<ref name=hot100>{{cite news|last1=Trust|first1=Gary|title=Meghan Trainor No. 1 On Hot 100, Jeremih Hits Top 10, Jennifer Lopez Debuts|url=http://www.billboard.com/articles/news/6259336/hot-100-meghan-trainor-jeremih-jennifer-lopez|accessdate=September 25, 2014|work=[[Billboard (magazine)|Billboard]]|date=September 24, 2014}}</ref> In April, the official song for the [[2014 FIFA World Cup]] performed by [[Pitbull (rapper)|Pitbull]], Lopez and Brazilian recording artist [[Claudia Leitte]], "[[We Are One (Ole Ola)]]", was released. She was ranked as the sixth highest-paid woman in music for the year, earning $37 million.<ref>{{cite web|title=Jennifer Lopez ($37 million)|url=http://www.forbes.com/pictures/eeel45emikk/6-jennifer-lopez-37-million/|website=Forbes|publisher=Forbes, Inc.|accessdate=January 25, 2015}}</ref>

January 2015 saw the release of \'\'[[The Boy Next Door (film)|The Boy Next Door]]\'\', an erotic thriller which Lopez both co-produced and starred in as a high school teacher who becomes involved with a student, which eventually leads to his dangerous obsession with her.<ref name="HuffPost Latino">{{cite web|last1=Moreno|first1=Carolina|title=Jennifer Lopez On Why Her New Movie Is \'Breaking Down\' Stereotypes|url=http://www.huffingtonpost.com/2014/12/23/jennifer-lopez-ryan-guzman_n_6373936.html|website=The Huffington Post|publisher=HuffPost Latino|accessdate=December 27, 2014|date=December 23, 2014}}</ref> The film received negative reviews from critics.<ref>{{cite news|title=\'Strange Magic,\' \'Mortdecai,\' \'The Boy Next Door\': Review Revue|url=http://blogs.wsj.com/speakeasy/2015/01/23/strange-magic-mortdecai-the-boy-next-door-review-revue/|accessdate=January 24, 2015|work=[[The Wall Street Journal]]|publisher=[[News Corp]]|date=January 23, 2015}}</ref> Despite this, it became her most successful opening at the box office for a live action film since \'\'Monster-in-Law\'\'.<ref>{{cite web|last1=Mendelson|first1=Scott|title=Friday Box Office: Johnny Depp\'s \'Mortdecai\' Flops, Jennifer Lopez\'s \'Boy Next Door\' Scores|url=http://www.forbes.com/sites/scottmendelson/2015/01/24/friday-box-office-johnny-depps-mortdecai-flops-jennifer-lopezs-boy-next-door-scores/|website=Forbes|publisher=Forbes, Inc.|accessdate=January 26, 2015|date=January 24, 2015}}</ref> The following month, she unveiled her next fragrance, JLuxe.<ref>{{cite news|last1=Parker|first1=Heidi|title=Now she\'s just showing off! Jennifer Lopez, 45, reveals her impressive cleavage yet again for sexy new JLuxe perfume ad|url=http://www.dailymail.co.uk/tvshowbiz/article-2941621/Jennifer-Lopez-45-reveals-impressive-cleavage-sexy-new-JLuxe-perfume-ad.html|accessdate=February 8, 2015|work=[[Daily Mail]]|publisher=[[DMG Media]]|date=February 6, 2015}}</ref> Lopez had a voice role in the animated feature \'\'[[Home (2015 film)|Home]]\'\', alongside [[Steve Martin]], [[Jim Parsons]], and [[Rihanna]], and released in March 2015.<ref name="Martin & Lopez">{{cite web|last=Dickey|first=Josh|title=Jennifer Lopez, Steve Martin Board DreamWorks Animation\'s \'Home\' (Exclusive)|url=http://www.thewrap.com/steve-martin-jennifer-lopez-board-dreamworks-animations-home-exclusive/|publisher=The Wrap News Inc|accessdate=October 4, 2013|date=October 3, 2013}}</ref> She contributed the single "[[Feel the Light]]" to the film\'s official soundtrack.<ref>{{cite web|url=http://www.mtv.co.uk/jennifer-lopez/news/premiere-watch-jennifer-lopezs-cute-feel-the-light-video|title=Exclusive! Watch Jennifer Lopez\'s Cute \'Feel The Light\' Video|work=\'\'[[MTV (UK and Ireland)|MTV UK]]\'\'|last=Pell|first=Michael|date=February 24, 2015|accessdate=February 26, 2015}}</ref> 

In 2015, Lopez will also star in the independent film \'\'[[Lila & Eve]]\'\' (alongside [[Viola Davis]]).<ref>{{cite web|last=Seidman|first=Robert|title=Viola Davis & Jennifer Lopez To Star In Indie Film \'Lila and Eve\' Produced By Lifetime Films & A+E Studios|url=http://tvbythenumbers.zap2it.com/2014/01/27/viola-davis-jennifer-lopez-to-star-in-indie-film-lila-and-eve-produced-by-lifetime-films-ae-studios/232388/|work=[[Zap2it]]|publisher=[[Tribune Media Services]]|accessdate=March 11, 2014|date=January 27, 2014}}</ref> She will also venture into television. [[NBC]] has ordered a 13-episode television drama, in which she will executive produce and star. In the series, titled \'\'Shades of Blue\'\', expected to air in the 2015\xe2\x80\x9316 television season, she will portray a single mother and police detective who goes undercover for the FBI to investigate her own squad. [[Ryan Seacrest]] will also produce the series.<ref>{{cite web|url=http://variety.com/2014/tv/news/nbc-orders-cop-drama-starring-jennifer-lopez-to-series-1201116116/ |title=NBC Orders Cop Drama Starring Jennifer Lopez to Series |publisher=Variety.com |date=2014-02-21 |accessdate=2014-07-20}}</ref> Lopez has revealed plans to release a Christmas album followed by a second Spanish-language album.<ref>{{cite web|last1=Nagi|first1=Ariel|title=J.Lo Plans to Make Another Spanish Album Next Year|url=http://www.cosmopolitan.com/entertainment/news/a26520/jlo-spanish-album/|website=[[Cosmopolitan (magazine)|Cosmopolitan]]|publisher=[[Hearst Corporation]]|accessdate=August 5, 2014|date=June 9, 2014}}</ref>

==Personal life==
[[File:Time 100 Jennifer Lopez and Marc Anthony.jpg|thumb|left|Anthony and Lopez, 2006]]
Lopez\'s personal life has attracted widespread media attention.<ref>{{cite web|author=|url=http://tvnz.co.nz/view/page/411319/609926 |title=J-Lo\'s mum approves of Redford film |publisher=TVNZ |date=September 9, 2005 |accessdate=June 18, 2013}}</ref> From February 22, 1997 to January 1998, she was married to Cuban waiter Ojani Noa.<ref name="A blow for J.Lo">{{cite news|url=http://www.dailymail.co.uk/tvshowbiz/article-1391664/Jennifer-Lopezs-ex-husband-wins-legal-fight-release-embarrassing-home-video.html |title=Jennifer Lopez\'s ex-husband wins legal fight to release embarrassing home video &#124; Mail Online |work=Daily Mail  |publisher=Associated Newspapers, Ltd|date=May 27, 2011 |accessdate=December 10, 2012}}</ref> Since their brief marriage, Lopez has endured legal troubles regarding Noa. She sued to prevent him from publishing a book about their marriage in April 2006, contending that it violated their confidentiality agreement.<ref>{{cite web |url=http://www.mtv.com/news/articles/1528384/20060411/lopez_jennifer.jhtml?headlines=true |title=Jennifer Lopez Sues First Husband To Block Tell-All Book |author=Chris Harris |accessdate=January 16, 2007 |work=MTV News. Viacom International, Inc. |date=April 11, 2006}}</ref> The following year, a court-appointed arbitrator issued a permanent injunction forbidding Noa from "criticizing, denigrating, casting in a negative light or otherwise disparaging" Lopez. She was awarded $545,000 in compensatory damages and Noa was ordered to hand over all copies of materials related to the book to Lopez or her attorney.<ref>{{cite news | url=http://www.smh.com.au/news/people/jlo-wins-payout-from-ex-over-tellall-memoir/2007/08/09/1186530500816.html | title=J-Lo Wins Payout From Ex | accessdate=August 28, 2007 |work=Sydney Morning Herald |publisher=Fairfax Media| date=August 9, 2007}}</ref> A lawsuit regarding a compromising private honeymoon video in Noa\'s possession is presently running.<ref>{{cite news|url=http://latino.foxnews.com/latino/entertainment/2013/06/13/jennifer-lopezs-ex-holding-out-for-more-money-in-honeymoon-video-lawsuit/ |title=Jennifer Lopez\xe2\x80\x99s Ex Holding Out For More Money In Honeymoon Video Lawsuit &#124; Fox News Latino |publisher=Fox News Latino|date=June 13, 2013 |accessdate=June 18, 2013}}</ref>

While working on her first album \'\'On the 6\'\', Lopez began dating record producer and rapper [[Sean Combs]]. On December 27, 1999, the couple were arrested along with two others in connection with a shooting outside the [[Times Square]] Club in [[New York]]. They were charged with criminal possession of a weapon as well as stolen property. Lopez was soon exonerated, having had nothing to do with the crime.<ref>{{cite web|last=Rosen|first=Craig|title=Jennifer Lopez Not Down With Guns|url=http://www.music.yahoo.ca/read/news/12056140|publisher=Yahoo! Music News|accessdate=April 8, 2013|date=January 14, 2000}}</ref> However, Combs was charged and indicted by a [[Manhattan]] [[grand jury]].<ref>{{cite web|last=Rosen|first=Craig|title=Jennifer Lopez \'Surprised And Saddened\' By Puffy Indictment|url=http://www.music.yahoo.ca/read/news/12063159|publisher=Yahoo! Music News|accessdate=April 8, 2013|date=January 14, 2000}}</ref> After leaving Combs, Lopez developed a relationship with former back-up dancer [[Cris Judd]], whom she was married to from September 29, 2001 to June 2002.<ref>{{cite journal|title=Jennifer Lopez, husband Cris Judd split after 8 months of marriage|journal=San Jose Mercury News|publisher=MediaNews Group|date=June 8, 2002|location=California}}</ref> Following her second divorce, she commenced a high-profile relationship with actor and director [[Ben Affleck]], whom she became engaged to in November 2002.<ref>{{cite journal|last=Silverman|first=Stephen|title=Ben\'s Proposal \'Beautiful,\' Says Lopez|url=http://www.people.com/people/article/0,,624998,00.html|journal=[[People (American magazine)|People]]|publisher=Time Inc.|accessdate=October 20, 2012|date=November 11, 2002}}</ref><ref>{{cite news|last=Williams|first=Jeanne|title=J. Lo, Ben make first appearance as fiances|newspaper=[[USA Today]]|publisher=[[Gannett Company]]|date=December 10, 2002|page=2}}</ref> The media began to refer to them as "Bennifer" and they became a prominent [[supercouple]] in the media and popular culture. Bennifer became a popular term, which was eventually entered into [[Urban Dictionary|urban dictionaries]] and [[neologism]] dictionaries as notable,<ref>{{cite web|title=Neologisms. These are neologisms collected by an undergraduate linguistics class at Rice University during the fall of 2003|publisher=ruf.rice.edu|accessdate=June 22, 2007|url=http://www.ruf.rice.edu/~kemmer/Words04/neologisms/a.html#b}}</ref> as the name blend started the trend of other celebrity couples being referred to by the combination of their first names.<ref name="Celebrity Name Game">{{cite journal|url=http://www.people.com/people/article/0,,1133516,00.html |title=Celebrity Name Game |journal=People |publisher=Time Inc.|date=November 23, 2005 |accessdate=July 7, 2012}}</ref> The couple postponed their nuptials indefinitely a day prior to the planned ceremony in September 2003, citing the media\'s interference with the event as the reason.<ref>{{cite news|title=Media in frenzy over postponed \'Bennifer\' wedding|url=http://www.theage.com.au/articles/2003/09/12/1063341766856.html|accessdate=February 25, 2012|newspaper=The Age|publisher=Fairfax Media|date=September 13, 2003|location=Los Angeles}}</ref>

Following her break-up with Affleck in January 2004, Lopez began dating long-time friend [[Marc Anthony]] (born as Marco Antonio Mu\xc3\xb1iz). The couple wed that June,<ref>{{cite web|author=Andrew Dansby |url=http://www.rollingstone.com/music/news/j-lo-marc-anthony-marry-20040607 |title=J.Lo, Marc Anthony Marry &#124; Music News |work=Rolling Stone |publisher=Jann Wenner|date=June 7, 2004 |accessdate=April 1, 2012}}</ref><ref>{{cite news|title=Wedding highlights J.Lo\'s true talent: getting us talking|url=http://nl.newsbank.com/nl-search/we/Archives?p_product=AASB&p_theme=aasb&p_action=search&p_maxdocs=200&p_topdoc=1&p_text_direct-0=1031F01295C1112D&p_field_direct-0=document_id&p_perpage=10&p_sort=YMD_date:D&s_trackval=GooglePM|accessdate=February 25, 2012 | newspaper=Austin American-Statesman|publisher=[[Cox Enterprises]]|date=June 9, 2004}}</ref> and lived in [[Brookville, New York]].<ref>[http://hollywoodlife.com/2011/07/19/jennifer-lopez-marc-anthony-divorce-properties-houses-brookville-new-york/ Jennifer Lopez & Marc Anthony Own $5.75 Million Worth Of Property In New York: Who Will Get It?] Retrieved 2014-09-05</ref> Two men attempted to ransom a private wedding video which was stolen from the couple for one million dollars; however they were arraigned in Manhattan Criminal Court on charges of conspiracy, attempted grand larceny and possession of stolen property.<ref>{{cite web|url=http://msnbc.msn.com/id/10643569/site/todayshow/ns/today-entertainment/t/lopez-anthony-wedding-video-leads-arrests/#.T21q1RGPXi4 |title=Lopez-Anthony wedding video leads to arrests&nbsp;\xe2\x80\x93 Entertainment&nbsp;\xe2\x80\x93 Celebrities |publisher=MSNBC |accessdate=April 1, 2012}}</ref> On November 7, 2007, during the final night of their co-headlining tour, Lopez and Anthony officially confirmed that they were expecting their first child.<ref>{{cite news|url=http://news.bbc.co.uk/1/hi/entertainment/7084486.stm|title=Singer Lopez confirms pregnancy|publisher=BBC News |date=November 8, 2007|accessdate=November 9, 2007}}</ref> The announcement ended months of speculation over the pregnancy.<ref>{{cite web|url=http://www.hollyscoop.com/jennifer-lopez/roberto-cavalli-confirms-jlos-pregnancy.html |title=Roberto Cavalli Confirms J.Lo\'s Pregnancy&nbsp;\xe2\x80\x93 Jennifer Lopez |publisher=Hollyscoop.com |accessdate=March 21, 2012}}{{Dead link|date=December 2013}}</ref> Her father confirmed that the couple were expecting twins, revealing that it runs in the family: "My sister also had twins, so it\'s a hereditary thing".<ref>{{cite journal|url=http://www.nme.com/news/jennifer-lopez/34139 |title=Jennifer Lopez expecting twins |journal=[[NME]] |publisher=Time Inc.|date=February 6, 2008 |accessdate=November 12, 2012}}</ref>

Lopez gave birth to a son, Maximilian David and a daughter, Emme Maribel, in [[Long Island]], New York on February 22, 2008.<ref name="Welcomes Twins">{{cite web|url=http://www.people.com/people/article/0,,20171851,00.html|date=February 22, 2008|title=Jennifer Lopez & Marc Anthony Welcome Twins!|work=People|publisher=Time Inc.|accessdate=February 22, 2008}}</ref><ref>{{cite web|url=http://www.people.com/people/article/0,,20181407,00.html|title=Jennifer Lopez & Marc Anthony Reveal Baby Names|work=People |publisher=Time Inc. |accessdate=February 29, 2008}}</ref> The twins were introduced in the March 11, 2008 issue of \'\'People\'\', for which the magazine paid a reported $6&nbsp;million&nbsp;\xe2\x80\x94 the photographs of the twins became [[List of most expensive celebrity photographs|the most expensive celebrity picture ever taken]] at the time.<ref>{{cite news|url=http://www.forbes.com/2009/07/01/michael-jackson-magazine-business-media-jackson.html |title=Jackson Pic Won\'t Make List Of Priciest Celeb Photos |work=Forbes |publisher=Forbes Publishing|accessdate=March 21, 2012 |first=Lacey |last=Rose}}</ref> Three years later in July 2011, the couple announced their split, with Anthony filing for divorce in April 2012.<ref>{{cite web|url=http://hollywoodlife.com/2012/04/11/jennifer-lopez-divorce-marc-anthony-jlo/ |title=Jennifer Lopez Divorce&nbsp;\xe2\x80\x94 Marc Anthony Files Divorce From JLo |publisher=HollywoodLife. PMC |date=April 11, 2012 |accessdate=June 18, 2013}}</ref> The divorce was finalized in June 2014.<ref>{{cite web|last1=D\'Zurilla|first1=Christie|title=Jennifer Lopez, Marc Anthony finalize years-long divorce|url=http://www.latimes.com/entertainment/gossip/la-et-mg-jennifer-lopez-marc-anthony-divorce-final-child-support-20140618-story.html|website=Los Angeles Times|publisher=Tribune Company|accessdate=June 19, 2014|date=June 18, 2014}}</ref> From October 2011 to June 2014, Lopez dated her former back-up dancer Casper Smart.<ref>{{cite web|last=Nudd |first=Tim |url=http://www.people.com/article/jennifer-lopez-casper-smart-split |title=Jennifer Lopez and Casper Smart Split - Breakups, Casper Smart, Jennifer Lopez |publisher=People.com |accessdate=2014-07-20}}</ref> On December 31, 2014 she legally changed her name back to Jennifer Lopez, dropping Anthony\'s last name (Mu\xc3\xb1iz).<ref>http://www.ctvnews.ca/entertainment/jennifer-lopez-gets-her-name-changed-1.2171025</ref>
Lopez has stated, "I am a non-traditional family. Me being a single mom, their dad doesn\'t live at home with them. They have three stepbrothers (sic){{note|they are actually her children\'s half-sister and two half-brothers}} from two other mothers... that\xe2\x80\x99s not traditional".<ref name="October 11">{{cite news|url=http://www.nydailynews.com/entertainment/gossip/jennifer-lopez-perfect-definition-family-supposed-article-1.1357985#ixzz2WA76PsoV |title=Jennifer Lopez on raising kids with ex Marc Anthony: \'I am a nontraditional family\' |newspaper=Daily News |publisher=Mortimer Zuckerman |date=May 29, 2013 |accessdate=June 18, 2013}}</ref>

==Artistry==

===Musical style===
{{Listen
| pos = right
| filename = Waiting for Tonight.ogg
| title = "Waiting for Tonight"
| description = A twenty-five-second sample of "[[Waiting for Tonight]]". It is a [[dance-pop]] party song that incorporates [[Latin American music|Latin]] and [[Europop|European]] influences.<ref name="Garvin">{{cite web|last1=Blumentrath|first1=Jan|title=Interview with Michael Garvin|url=http://hitquarters.com/index.php3?page=intrview/2005/July24_5_50_38.html|publisher=Hitquarters.com|accessdate=January 6, 2015|date=July 24, 2005}}</ref><ref name="Variety" />
}}
Over the course of her career, Lopez\'s music has covered a wide range of genres including Latin pop, dance, R&B, hip hop, rock, funk, house and salsa. According to author Ed Morales, her music explores both the "romantic innocence of Latin music" and hip hop.<ref>{{cite book|last=Morales|first=Ed|title=The Latin Beat: The Rhythms And Roots Of Latin Music From Bossa Nova To Salsa And Beyond|year=2003|publisher=Da Capo Press|isbn=078673020X|page=163}}</ref> While heavily influenced by Latin musical styles ranging from [[salsa (music)|salsa]] to [[Bachata (music)|bachata]], it was the 1979 hip hop song "[[Rapper\'s Delight]]" by hip hop trio [[The Sugarhill Gang]] that inspired her career. On her first album \'\'On the 6\'\' (1999), Lopez fused Latin music together with the hip hop sound she loved, which she described as being [[Latin soul]].<ref name="Woog08">{{harvnb|Woog|2008}}</ref>

Much of her early music was centered around dance, funk, urban and Latin-influenced music.<ref name="Thru1">{{cite web|last=Dinh|first=James|title=J.Lo Contemplates \'Love\' (And Love?) Through The Years|url=http://newsroom.mtv.com/2011/05/03/jlo-contemplates-love-and-love-through-the-years/|publisher=MTV Newsroom. Viacom International, Inc.|accessdate=April 7, 2013|date=May 3, 2011}}</ref><ref name="Back">{{cite news|last=Morales|first=Ed|title=It\'s Not La Vida Loca to Her|url=http://articles.latimes.com/1999/may/30/entertainment/ca-42339|accessdate=March 11, 2012|newspaper=Los Angeles Times|publisher=Tribune Company|date=March 30, 1999}}</ref><ref name="DVD Talk">{{cite web|url=http://www.dvdtalk.com/reviews/6295/jennifer-lopez-on-the-6/ |title=Jennifer Lopez: On The 6 : DVD Talk Review of the Audio |publisher=[[DVD Talk]]. Internet Brands, Inc. |accessdate=July 11, 2012}}</ref> With her second album \'\'J.Lo\'\' (2001), Lopez wrote more personal songs, while retaining the same sound as her first.<ref name="Personal">{{cite web|title=A whole lotta Lopez|url=http://jam.canoe.ca/Movies/Artists/L/Lopez_Jennifer/2001/01/21/759920.html|publisher=Canoe|accessdate=April 12, 2013|date=January 21, 2001}}</ref> Empowerment and sex are among the album\'s themes.<ref name="Slant Magazine">{{cite web|last=Cinquemani|first=Sal|title=Jennifer Lopez: J.Lo|url=http://www.slantmagazine.com/music/review/jennifer-lopez-j-lo/208|publisher=[[Slant Magazine]]|accessdate=April 13, 2013|date=February 11, 2001}}</ref> A departure from her previous albums, \'\'This Is Me... Then\'\' (2002) evokes 1970s [[soul music]], with Lopez stating that: "This record has a little bit of that nostalgia in it", while its lyrical content was influenced by her relationship with Ben Affleck. This is most evident within the song "Dear Ben".<ref name=guardian>{{cite news|author=Betty Clarke |url=http://www.guardian.co.uk/music/2002/nov/29/popandrock.artsfeatures2 |title=CD: Jennifer Lopez: This Is Me...Then &#124; Culture |publisher=The Guardian |date= November 29, 2002|accessdate=March 30, 2012 |location=London}}</ref><ref name="RockBlock">{{cite web|title=J.Lo: The Rock And The Block|url=http://www.mtv.com/bands/l/lopez_jennifer/news_feature_021108/index2.jhtml#|publisher=MTV. MTV Networks|accessdate=April 3, 2013}}</ref> \'\'Rebirth\'\' (2005) explored more of a pop rock and funk sound, with a strong utilization of percussion and horns.<ref name=yahoor>{{cite web|url=http://voices.yahoo.com/jennifer-lopez-rebirth-album-review-68857.html |title=Jennifer Lopez: Rebirth (Album Review) |publisher=Yahoo! Voices |date=March 1, 2005 |accessdate=April 29, 2012}}{{dead link|date=August 2014}}</ref> \'\'Como Ama una Mujer\'\' (2007), her first full Spanish-language album, includes introspective lyrics about love, heartache and self-loathing. It has a more softer sound than her previous works.<ref name="Reed">{{cite news|url=http://boston.com/ae/music/cd_reviews/articles/2007/03/27/lopez_turns_the_lights_down_low |title=Jennifer Lopez goes unabashedly romantic with \'Como Ama una Mujer\'|work=[[The Boston Globe]]|publisher=[[The New York Times Company]]|date=March 27, 2007 |accessdate=June 3, 2012 |first=James |last=Reed}}</ref> \'\'Brave\'\' (2007) and \'\'Love?\'\' (2011) are rooted more in a dance music direction.<ref name="Allmusic Brave">{{cite web|last=Erlewine |first=Stephen Thomas |url=http://www.allmusic.com/album/brave-r1208434 |title=Brave&nbsp;\xe2\x80\x93 Jennifer Lopez |publisher=[[AllMusic]]. Rovi Corporation |accessdate=November 10, 2011}}</ref> Songs from \'\'Love?\'\' such as "[[Until It Beats No More]]" and "[[One Love (Jennifer Lopez song)|One Love]]" are also deeply personal songs.<ref>{{cite news |last=Markovitz |first=Adam |title=Jennifer Lopez&nbsp;\xe2\x80\x93 Love? (album review) |url=http://www.ew.com/ew/article/0,,20485119,00.html |work=[[Entertainment Weekly]] |publisher=Time Inc. |date=April 27, 2011 |accessdate=May 28, 2011}}</ref> Lopez describes her music as autobiographical.<ref>{{cite web|title=How Jennifer Lopez Turned Hitting \'Rock Bottom\' Into A Memoir|url=http://www.huffingtonpost.com/2014/11/05/jennifer-lopez-_n_6107300.html|website=The Huffington Post|accessdate=January 1, 2015|date=November 5, 2014}}</ref>

Lopez has been influenced by artists such as [[Tina Turner]], [[James Brown]], [[Michael Jackson]], [[Madonna (entertainer)|Madonna]] and [[Barbra Streisand]].<ref name="10 Questions for Lopez">{{cite journal|author=Department Thursday, October 18, 2007 |url=http://www.time.com/time/magazine/article/0,9171,1673250,00.html |title=10 Questions for Jennifer Lopez |journal=Time |publisher=Time Inc.|date=October 18, 2007 |accessdate=August 18, 2012}}</ref><ref>{{cite web|last=Miller|first=Prairie|title=NY Rock Interview with Jennifer Lopez|url=http://www.nyrock.com/interviews/2002/lopez_int3.asp|publisher=\'\'NY Rock\'\'|accessdate=February 12, 2012}}</ref><ref>{{cite web|title=Jennifer Lopez \'graduated\' as a singer while singing for hubby|url=http://www.indianexpress.com/news/jennifer-lopez-graduated-as-a-singer-while/558630/|publisher=\'\'Indian Express\'\'}}</ref> Critics have considered Lopez\'s [[soubrette]] vocal type to be limited,<ref>{{cite web|url=http://www.contactmusic.com/pages/jenniferlopezx18x03x05 |title=Jennifer Lopez&nbsp;\xe2\x80\x93 Rebirth&nbsp;\xe2\x80\x93 Album Review |publisher=Contactmusic.com |accessdate=April 1, 2012}}</ref><ref name=vocall>{{cite web|title=Jennifer Lopez finds her voice on new album|url=http://www.rap-up.com/2011/02/02/jennifer-lopez-finds-her-voice-on-new-album/#more-72798|work=Rap-Up |publisher=SpinMedia|accessdate=February 12, 2012}}</ref> and obscured by the production of her music, while remaining "radio-friendly".<ref>{{cite journal|last=Henderling|first=Lisa|title=Revolutions|journal=Vibe|date=December 2007|volume= 15| issue =  12|page=107|publisher=[[Vibe Media Group]]|issn=1070-4701}}</ref> \'\'[[Rolling Stone]]\'\' observed: "Instead of strained vocal pyrotechnics, Lopez sticks to the understated R&B murmur of a round-the-way superstar who doesn\'t need to belt because she knows you\'re already paying attention [...] She makes a little va-va and a whole lot of voom go a long way."<ref name="Rolling">{{cite web|last=Sheffield|first=Rob|title=On the 6 {{!}} Album Reviews|url=http://www.rollingstone.com/music/albumreviews/on-the-6-19990708|work=Rolling Stone|publisher=Jann Wenner|accessdate=April 8, 2013|date=July 8, 1999}}</ref> Meanwhile, [[AllMusic]]\'s [[Stephen Thomas Erlewine]] called her voice "slight" and wrote: "Lopez was never, ever about singing; she was about style, particularly the kind that passes for fashionable at glitzy high-rise discos."<ref name="Erlewine">{{cite web|author=Stephen Thomas Erlewine|url={{Allmusic|class=album|id=love-r2142805|pure_url=yes}}|title= Love?&nbsp;\xe2\x80\x93 Jennifer Lopez &#124; Allmusic|publisher=[[Allmusic]]|date=April 19, 2011|accessdate=May 3, 2011}}</ref> \'\'[[Entertainment Weekly]]\'\' criticized her vocal performance for lacking the trademark "husky-voiced voluptuousness" she has in her films.<ref name="EW">{{cite news|last=Browne|first=David|title=On the 6 (1999)|url=http://www.ew.com/ew/article/0,,273612,00.html|work=Entertainment Weekly|publisher=Time Inc.|accessdate=April 7, 2013|date=June 4, 1999}}</ref> \'\'[[The Baltimore Sun]]\'\' regards Lopez as having a "breathy" stylistic range, but lacking personality.<ref>{{cite journal|last=Considine|first=J.D.|title=Actress Jennifer Lopez can sing, but it isn\'t enough|journal=The Baltimore Sun|date=June 3, 1999|publisher=[[Tribune Company]]|issn=1930-8965}}</ref>

===Dance and stage===
Lopez has felt an emotional connection to dance since her childhood.<ref name="Dance buzz">{{cite web|last=Vena |first=Jocelyn |url=http://www.mtv.com/news/articles/1659131/jennifer-lopez-on-the-floor-video.jhtml |title=Jennifer Lopez\'s \'On The Floor\' Video Creates \'Dance Buzz\'&nbsp;\xe2\x80\x93 Music, Celebrity, Artist News |publisher=MTV News. Viacom International, Inc. |date=March 3, 2011 |accessdate=May 31, 2013}}</ref> Growing up, she specialized in ballet, jazz and flamenco dance genres.<ref name="Shall We Dance? - Interview">{{cite web|last=Boccard|first=Sophia|title=Jennifer Lopez Interview for Shall We Dance?|url=http://www.thecinemasource.com/blog/interviews/jennifer-lopez-interview-for-shall-we-dance/|publisher=The Cinema Source. TCS Entertainment Network|accessdate=June 30, 2013|date=January 28, 2008}}</ref> Her career commenced on the variety television sketch comedy series \'\'[[In Living Color]]\'\', where she was a part of an ethnically diverse dance group labeled The Fly Girls.<ref name="Hip Hop Dance">{{cite book|last=Rajakumar|first=Mohanalakshmi|title=The American Dancefloor: Hip Hop Dance|year=2012|publisher=Abc-Clio|isbn=0313378452|pages=78, 79|edition=Illustrated}}</ref> Lopez briefly served as a back-up dancer to recording artist [[Janet Jackson]], who she claimed to have a considerable influence over her choreography. After beginning her own recording career, Lopez\'s provocatively choreographed debut music video for "If You Had My Love" allowed her to become a dominant figure on [[MTV]] Networks worldwide.<ref>{{cite journal|title=Asia Pacific|journal=Billboard|date=August 7, 1999|volume= 111| issue =  32|publisher=[[Nielsen Business Media]], Inc|issn=0006-2510}}</ref> Since, Lopez has become well known for her body-emphasizing music videos such as "[[Waiting for Tonight#Music video|Waiting for Tonight]]", "[[I\'m Glad]]", "[[Dance Again#Music video|Dance Again]]" and "[[Booty (song)|Booty]]" among others, some of which have been the subject of controversy and scrutiny.<ref>{{cite web|last=Costanza|first=Ashley Justine|title=Jennifer Lopez\'s \'Dance Again\' Video Stirs Controversy: Her Five Trashiest Videos|url=http://www.ibtimes.com/jennifer-lopezs-dance-again-video-stirs-controversy-her-five-trashiest-videos-435170|work=International Business Times|publisher=IBT Media Inc.|accessdate=June 30, 2013|date=April 9, 2012}}</ref><ref>{{cite web|title=Nobody Puts J.Lo\'s Booty in a Box|url=http://www.etonline.com/news/151961_jennifer_lopez_defends_her_booty_video_talks_scary_car_accident/|website=ETOnline|publisher=CBS Television Distribution|accessdate=December 27, 2014|date=October 1, 2014}}</ref> For the film \'\'Shall We Dance?\'\' (2004), Lopez learned a new genre of dance: ballroom.<ref>{{cite journal|title=Director hopes audience will find \'Dance\'|journal=The New Tribune|date=October 16, 2004|publisher=[[The McClatchy Company]]|location=Tacoma, Washington}}</ref> Lopez often includes dance routines in her music videos.<ref>{{cite book|title=Sexual Teens, Sexual Media: Investigating Medi\xc3\xa1s Influence on Adolescent Sexuality|year=2002|publisher=Routledge|isbn=0805834907|page=260|author=Jane Delano Brown, Jeanne R. Steele, Kim Walsh-Childers}}</ref>

Author Priscilla Pe\xc3\xb1a Ovalle stated in \'\'Dance and the Hollywood Latina: Race, Sex and Stardom\'\' (2011) that Lopez was one of the Latin female stars who "used dance to gain agency as working performers with mainstream careers, yet many of their roles paradoxically racialized and sexualized their bodies".<ref name="Dance Hollywood Latina">{{cite book|last=Pe\xc3\xb1a Ovalle|first=Priscilla|title=Dance and the Hollywood Latina: Race, Sex, and Stardom|year=2011|publisher=Rutgers University Press|isbn=0813548802|pages=3\xe2\x80\x934}}</ref> Troy Patterson of \'\'[[Entertainment Weekly]]\'\' also observed that she used her body for emphasis on stage, "She turned herself out as the fly girl hyperversion of postfeminist power, flaunting her control by toying with the threat of excess. In consequence, her star went supernova."<ref>{{cite news|last=Patterson|first=Troy|title=Rock Frock|url=http://www.ew.com/ew/article/0,,92259,00.html|work=Entertainment Weekly|publisher=Time Inc.|accessdate=June 30, 2013|date=December 19, 2000}}</ref> Lopez and fellow entertainer [[Shakira]] are known for their signature moves which include "clock-wise pivoting with salsa hip circles and sequential torso undulations".<ref>{{cite book|last=Potuoglu-Cook|first=Oyku|title=Night Shifts: Moral, Economic, and Cultural Politics of Turkish Belly Dance|year=2008|publisher=ProQuest|isbn=0549541306|page=167}}</ref> Lopez is recognized for energetic and provocative stage performances, which have at times received scrutiny.<ref>{{cite web|last= Gruttadaro |first=Andrew |url=http://hollywoodlife.com/2013/05/27/selena-gomez-sexy-performances-miley-cyrus-rihanna-pics/ |title=Selena Gomez\xe2\x80\x99s Sexy Performances & More Hot Hollywood Stage Sirens |publisher=HollywoodLife. PMC |date=May 27, 2013 |accessdate=May 31, 2013}}</ref><ref>{{cite web|last=Solomons  |first=Tarryn  |url=http://www.iol.co.za/tonight/in-your-face-marc-1.1183920#.UahGdEBmiSo |title=In your face Marc |publisher=IOL Tonight|date=November 22, 2011 |accessdate=May 31, 2013}}</ref><ref>{{cite web|url=http://popcrush.com/john-legend-questo-jennifer-lopez-fiat/ |title=John Legend + Questo Ridicule Jennifer Lopez Over \xe2\x80\x98Shameless\xe2\x80\x99 Fiat Plug |publisher=Popcrush. Townsquare Media |accessdate=May 31, 2013}}</ref> She often includes costumes such as bodysuits as part of her performance.<ref>{{cite news|author=Amelia Proud |url=http://www.dailymail.co.uk/tvshowbiz/article-2214393/Jennifer-Lopez-cuts-devastatingly-curvy-silhouette-sheer-rhinestone-encrusted-bodysuit.html |title=Jennifer Lopez Cuts a Devastatingly Curvy Silhouette in Sheer Rhinestone-encrusted Bodysuit |publisher=\'\'Daily Mail\'\'. Associated Newspapers, Ltd|date=October 8, 2012 |accessdate=May 31, 2013}}</ref><ref>{{cite news|url=http://www.huffingtonpost.com/2011/11/21/jennifer-lopez-bodysuit-ama_n_1106714.html |title=Jennifer Lopez\' Bodysuit At The 2011 American Music Awards (Photos)|publisher=\'\'The Huffington Post\'\' |date=November 21, 2011 |accessdate=May 31, 2013 |first=Christina |last=Anderson}}</ref> While being noted to [[lip sync]] in the early stages of career, Lopez\'s Dance Again World Tour was praised for showcasing live vocals and choreography synchronously.<ref>{{cite journal|title=Lip syncing takes the fun out of seeing an artist live|journal=Contra Costa Times|date=June 21, 2002|publisher=[[MediaNews Group]]}}</ref><ref>{{cite web|last=Fuller |first=Bonnie  |url=http://hollywoodlife.com/2012/12/05/jennifer-lopez-dance-again-tour-divorce-marc-anthony/ |title=Jennifer Lopez \xe2\x80\x98Dance Again\xe2\x80\x99 Tour&nbsp;\xe2\x80\x94 Why She Had to Divorce Marc Anthony |publisher=Hollywood Life |date=December 5, 2012 |accessdate=May 31, 2013}}</ref><ref name="filipino">{{cite web|last=Concepcion|first=Pocholo|title=JLo enchants capacity crowd at MOA Arena concert|url=http://entertainment.inquirer.net/69407/jlo-enchants-capacity-crowd-at-moa-arena-concert|work=[[Philippine Daily Inquirer]]|publisher=Philippine Daily Inquirer, Inc.|accessdate=November 27, 2012|date=November 27, 2012}}</ref> In May 2013, Lopez\'s performance on the finale of the television series \'\'[[Britain\'s Got Talent]]\'\' was deemed inappropriate for family-friendly television, and drew viewer complaints to [[Ofcom]].<ref>{{cite news|url=http://www.dailymail.co.uk/tvshowbiz/article-2332453/Jennifer-Lopezs-raunchy-Britains-Got-Talent-performance-blasted-inappropriate-viewers.html |title=Jennifer Lopez\'s raunchy Britain\'s Got Talent performance blasted as \'inappropriate\' by viewers  |publisher=\'\'Daily Mail\'\'. Associated Newspapers, Ltd. |date= May 29, 2013|accessdate=May 31, 2013 |first1=Hanna |last1=Flint |first2=Louise |last2=Saunders}}</ref><ref>{{cite web|url=http://www.digitalspy.com.au/british-tv/s107/britains-got-talent/news/a486003/jennifer-lopez-britains-got-talent-producers-said-to-wear-outfit.html |title=Jennifer Lopez: \'Britain\'s Got Talent producers said to wear outfit\' |publisher=Digital Spy. Hearst Magazines UK |accessdate=May 31, 2013}}</ref>

==Public image==
[[File:LG JSOSPP7061102.jpg|thumb|left|200px|Lopez waving the [[Puerto Rico|Puerto Rican]] flag in 2009.]]
Speaking of Lopez\'s image, Andrew Barker of \'\'[[Variety (magazine)|Variety]]\'\' observed: "Despite a carefully cultivated image as an imperious pop empress in ludicrously expensive outfits, her signature hits bear the titles "I\xe2\x80\x99m Real" and "Jenny From the Block". She managed the perilous transition from actress to music star without ever seeming to pick either as a primary gig. She established herself as an oft-provocative sex symbol while her demeanor made it abundantly clear that she\xe2\x80\x99s not asking you to come hither."<ref name="Variety">{{cite news|last=Barker|first=Andrew|title=Jennifer Lopez Receives Star for Music on Hollywood Walk of Fame|url=http://variety.com/2013/scene/features/jennifer-lopez-receives-star-for-music-on-hollywood-walk-of-fame-1200493728/|work=Variety|publisher=Penske Business Media|accessdate=June 25, 2013|date=June 20, 2013}}</ref> In 2002, Lynette Holloway of \'\'[[The New York Times]]\'\' described Lopez as overexposed. She wrote: "Forgive yourself if you are seeing Jennifer Lopez in your sleep. She is everywhere." Holloway noted her image to be "a dash of \'\'ghetto fabulousness\'\'" and "middle-class respectability" for mass appeal.<ref>{{cite journal|last=Holloway|first=Lynette|title=Keeping J. Lo in Spotlight Has Risks for Her Career As Well as Rich Rewards|journal=[[The New York Times]]|date=December 9, 2002|url=http://www.nytimes.com/2002/12/09/business/keeping-j-lo-in-spotlight-has-risks-for-her-career-as-well-as-rich-rewards.html|accessdate=June 30, 2013|publisher=[[The New York Times Company]]}}</ref> Lopez is considered an [[pop icon|icon of popular culture]].<ref>{{cite web|url=http://www.prweb.com/releases/2005/10/prweb298759.htm |title=The Biggest Latin Vibe Sweeping America Is Up for Sale? |publisher=PRWeb |accessdate=November 12, 2012}}</ref> Television presenter [[Ray Martin (television presenter)|Ray Martin]] describes her as a "showbiz phenomenon".<ref>{{cite web|last=Martin|first=Ray|title=J-Lo|url=http://sixtyminutes.ninemsn.com.au/stories/raymartin/304846/j-lo|accessdate=February 28, 2012|date=October 11, 2007}}</ref> Lopez has developed an image as a sex symbol and "one of the most desirable women on the planet".<ref>{{cite news|url=http://www.dailymail.co.uk/tvshowbiz/article-2016603/Jennifer-Lopez-divorce-Controlling-Marc-Anthony-hated-J-Lo-sex-symbol.html |title=Jennifer Lopez divorce: Controlling Marc Anthony \'hated J-Lo being a sex symbol\' &#124; Mail Online |work=Daily Mail |publisher=Associated Newspapers, Ltd|date=July 20, 2011 |accessdate=August 19, 2012}}</ref> She is well known for her curvaceous figure,<ref>{{cite web|author=Katherine Ormerod |url=http://www.graziadaily.co.uk/fashion/archive/2012/04/30/the-rise-of-the-super-bum--kim-kardashian--nikki-minaj---jlo-show-how-to-dress-y.htm |title=The Rise of the Super Bum: Kim Kardashian, Nicki Minaj & Jennifer Lopez Show How to Dress Your Booty &#124; Grazia Fashion |publisher=\'\'Grazia\'\' |date=April 30, 2012 |accessdate=August 19, 2012}}</ref> which was the inspiration for [[Sir Mix-a-Lot]]\'s 1992 hit "[[Baby Got Back]]".<ref>{{cite web|title=Sir Mix-A-Lot Says \'Baby Got Back\' Is About Jennifer Lopez|url=http://www.spin.com/articles/sir-mix-a-lot-says-baby-got-back-is-about-jennifer-lopez/|website=Spin|publisher=SpinMedia|accessdate=January 4, 2015|date=November 13, 2014}}</ref> Widely recognized and celebrated for her figure, she has been credited with allowing women with curvaceous figures to be accepted.<ref>{{cite book|title=Mi Voz, Mi Vida/ My Voice, My Life: Latino College Students Tell Their Life Stories|year=2007|publisher=Cornwell University Press|isbn=0801473861|page=179|author=Andrew Garrod, Robert Kilkenny, Christina G\xc3\xb3mez}}</ref>

[[Details (magazine)|\'\'Details\'\']] magazine named Lopez the "Sexiest Woman of the Year" in 1998,<ref>{{cite news|last=Halza|first=George Halza|title=Jennifer Lopez named sexiest woman of the year|newspaper=[[Reading Eagle]]|date=November 16, 1998|page=5}}</ref> and she led \'\'[[FHM]]\'\'{{\'}}s "100 Sexiest Woman" list twice.<ref>{{cite web|url=http://www.fhm.com/girls/covergirls/jennifer-lopez |title=\'\'FHM\'\'&nbsp;\xe2\x80\x93 Jennifer Lopez |publisher=Fhm.com |accessdate=March 10, 2012}}</ref> In 2011, she was named the "[[People Magazine\'s 100 Most Beautiful People|The Most Beautiful Woman]]" by [[People (American magazine)|\'\'People\'\']].<ref>{{cite web|last=Jordan|first=Julie|title=Jennifer Lopez: Being Beautiful Is \'Part of My Job\'|url=http://www.people.com/people/package/article/0,,20360857_20481259,00.html|publisher=\'\'People\'\'. Time Inc.|accessdate=January 29, 2012|date=April 13, 2011}}</ref> In 2012, \'\'[[Complex (magazine)|Complex]]\'\' placed Lopez second on their list of "100 Hottest Female Singers of All Time", writing: "Lopez has dominated the entertainment industry and become the archetypal sexy singer."<ref>{{cite web|title=The 100 Hottest female Singers of All Time|url=http://www.complex.com/music/2012/12/the-100-hottest-female-singers-of-all-time/jennifer-lopez|work=[[Complex (magazine)|Complex]]|publisher=Complex Media|accessdate=June 30, 2013|author=Lauren Nostro, Julian Patterson|date=December 10, 2012}}</ref> The following year, [[VH1]] ranked her the fourth on their list of "100 Sexiest Artists",<ref>{{cite web|author=Ben\xc3\xa9 Viera |url=http://www.vh1.com/music/tuner/2013-03-05/vh1-100-sexiest-artists-complete-list/97/ |title=VH1\xe2\x80\xb2s 100 Sexiest Artists [Complete List&#93;&nbsp;\xe2\x80\x93 &#124; VH1 Tuner |publisher=VH-1. Viacom International, Inc. |date=March 5, 2013 |accessdate=April 19, 2013}}</ref> while [[Vibe (magazine)|\'\'Vibe\'\']] magazine named her the most "lustable" celebrity of the past twenty years.<ref>{{cite web|url=http://www.vibe.com/article/big-list-issue-19-most-lustable-celebs-93 |title=The 19 Most Lustable Celebs Since \'93 |publisher=Vibe |date=April 17, 2013 |accessdate=May 31, 2013}}</ref> In 2014, Lopez stated, "There\xe2\x80\x99s this funny notion in America that you can\xe2\x80\x99t be a mom and be sexy (...) It\xe2\x80\x99s the craziest thing I\xe2\x80\x99ve ever heard... The truth is that women can be sexy until the day they die."<ref name="HuffPost Latino"/>

Lopez is a [[Tabloid journalism|tabloid]] fixture<ref>{{cite news|last1=Lansky|first1=Sam|title=Jennifer Lopez Is Back On Top With \xe2\x80\x98Love?\xe2\x80\x99 Which Is Exactly Where She Deserves To Be|url=http://buzzworthy.mtv.com/2012/04/19/jennifer-lopez-love-on-the-floor-dance-again/|accessdate=January 28, 2015|work=[[MTV]]|publisher=[[Viacom]]|date=April 19, 2012}}</ref><ref>{{cite news|last1=Johnson|first1=Steve|title=Will Lopez, Tyler be good for \'American Idol\'?|url=http://articles.chicagotribune.com/2010-09-22/entertainment/chi-100922-american-idol-judges-strengths_1_kara-dioguardi-steven-tyler-classic-rock|accessdate=January 28, 2015|work=[[Chicago Tribune]]|publisher=[[Tribune Publishing]]|date=September 22, 2010}}</ref> and has admitted to having a "less-than-perfect" public image.<ref>{{cite web|last=Saney|first=Daniel|title=J.Lo blames films for bad public image|url=http://www.digitalspy.com.au/showbiz/news/a19076/jlo-blames-films-for-bad-public-image.html|publisher=Digital Spy. Hearst Magazines UK|accessdate=June 26, 2013|date=February 8, 2005}}</ref> The media often draw comparisons between Lopez and actress [[Elizabeth Taylor]], due to her numerous failed relationships.<ref>{{cite journal|journal=Vibe|date=July 2003|volume= 11| issue =  7|publisher=Vibe Media Group|issn=1070-4701}}</ref><ref>{{cite news|last=Hampson|first=Katie|title=Is J-Lo the new Liz Taylor?|url=http://www.dailymail.co.uk/tvshowbiz/article-305683/Is-J-Lo-new-Liz-Taylor.html|work=Daily Mail|publisher=(Associated Newspapers Ltd)|accessdate=September 24, 2013|date=June 8, 2004}}</ref>  In fact, Lopez has been dubbed a "modern-day Liz Taylor" by the media.<ref>{{cite journal|title=Lopez doesn\'t mind Liz link|journal=The Age|date=December 27, 2002|publisher=The Age Company, Ltd}}</ref> Lynn Hirschberg of \'\'[[W (magazine)|W]]\'\' compared her glamorous public persona to that of Taylor.<ref name="W2013">{{cite web|last=Hirschberg|first=Lynn|title=Jennifer Lopez: Dream Girl|url=http://www.wmagazine.com/people/celebrities/2013/07/jennifer-lopez-august-2013-cover/|work=W|publisher=Cond\xc3\xa9 Nast Publications|accessdate=July 10, 2013|date=July 9, 2013}}</ref> Her style is described by \'\'[[Billboard (magazine)|Billboard]]\'\'{{\'}}s Lauren Savage as scantily clad.<ref name="Scla">{{cite web|last=Savage|first=Lauren|title=J.Lo Plays Gender-Bending Boxer for V Magazine Cover|url=http://www.billboard.com/articles/columns/the-hook/502987/jlo-plays-gender-bending-boxer-for-v-magazine-cover|work=[[Billboard (magazine)|Billboard]]|publisher=[[Prometheus Global Media]]|accessdate=August 20, 2012|date=February 29, 2012}}</ref> Lopez has been criticized by the animal rights organization [[People for the Ethical Treatment of Animals|PETA]] for inclusion of fur in her fashion lines and outfits.<ref>{{cite web|url=http://www.peta.org/b/thepetafiles/archive/2011/08/04/how-low-will-j_2d00_lo-go_3f00_.aspx |title=PETA: How Low Will J-Lo Go? |publisher=PETA.org |accessdate=December 5, 2013 |archiveurl=http://web.archive.org/web/20111023225651/http://www.peta.org/b/thepetafiles/archive/2011/08/04/How-Low-Will-J_2D00_Lo-Go_3F00_.aspx |archivedate=October 23, 2011}}</ref> She has received a bad reputation as being a demanding "diva",<ref>{{cite web|title=Demanding diva Jennifer Lopez bans domestic staff from speaking to her|url=http://www.standard.co.uk/showbiz/celebrity-news/demanding-diva-jennifer-lopez-bans-domestic-staff-from-speaking-to-her-8134190.html|work=[[Evening Standard]]|accessdate=January 8, 2013|date=September 13, 2012}}</ref> though constantly refutes this.<ref name="ga23">{{cite news|title=\'I started going grey at 23,\' admits Jennifer Lopez as she is crowned World\'s Most Beautiful Woman|url=http://www.dailymail.co.uk/tvshowbiz/article-1376527/Jennifer-Lopez-tops-Most-Beautiful-list-People-magazine-2011.html|work=[[Daily Mail]]|publisher=[[Associated Newspapers Ltd]]|accessdate=January 8, 2013|date=April 14, 2011}}</ref>

==Legacy and cultural influence==
{{see also|List of awards and nominations received by Jennifer Lopez}}

[[File:Green Versace dress of Jennifer Lopez 2.jpg|thumb|right|140px|The iconic [[Green Versace dress of Jennifer Lopez|Green Versace dress]] Lopez wore to the [[42nd Grammy Awards]], on display at the [[Fashion Museum, Bath|Fashion Museum]].]]
Lopez is regarded as the most influential Hispanic performer in the United States, having broken racial barriers in the entertainment industry.<ref name=rantrack /> \'\'[[The Record (Waterloo Region)|The Record]]\'\' newspaper observed that she was responsible for the introduction of a Latin presence in the film industry.<ref name=therecord>{{cite journal|last=Pearlman|first=Cindy|title=For the record; Very hot and ambitious actress Jennifer Lopez has music on her mind|journal=[[The Record (Waterloo Region)|The Record]]|publisher=[[Torstar|Torstar Corporation]] |ISSN=0824-5150|date=August 14, 1999|location=Kitchener, Ontario}}</ref> In \'\'Icons of American Popular Culture: From P.T. Barnum to Jennifer Lopez\'\' (2009), author Robert C.
